questions.question: When will President-Elect Joe Biden take office?

questions.title: Election aftermath
questions.description: The Trump campaign has taken legal action disputing Biden's victory, citing voter fraud; no fraud has yet been found. Trump has yet to concede the race, a traditional move by previous candidates.

imageMetadata.altText: President Trump holds a note with the early results from the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
imageMetadata.resources: President Donald Trump holds a note with the early results from the 2020 U.S. presidential election as he speaks in the East Room of the White House in Washington, U.S. Photo by Carlos Barria/Reuters

questions.resources: President Donald Trump holds a note with the early results from the 2020 U.S. presidential election as he speaks in the East Room of the White House in Washington, U.S. Photo by Carlos Barria/Reuters

questions.title: U.S. Senate seats in Georgia
questions.description: There are two "runoff" elections in Georgia, which means there's a rematch because neither candidate got 50% of the votes. The rematch election will take place in January and will determine which party gets a majority of Senate seats.

questions.question: If Joe Biden gets a Democrat-majority in the Senate, it will be easier for him to get new policies passed.

imageMetadata.altText: A general view of the U.S. Capitol Building in Washington, D.C. at sunset.
imageMetadata.resources: A general view of the U.S. Capitol Building in Washington, D.C., on October 14, 2020.  (Graeme Sloan/Sipa USA)No Use UK. No Use Germany./File Photo

questions.question: Kamala Harris made a list of "firsts," including first _____ to be elected Vice President.

imageMetadata.altText: Kamala Harris giving victory speech in Delaware on Saturday, Nov. 7, 2020
imageMetadata.resources: Democratic 2020 U.S. vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris speaks at their election rally, after the news media announced that Democratic 2020 U.S. presidential nominee Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election over President Donald Trump, in Wilmington, Delaware, Nov. 7, 2020. REUTERS/Jim Bourg

questions.resources: Democratic 2020 U.S. vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris speaks at their election rally, after the news media announced that Democratic 2020 U.S. presidential nominee Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election over President Donald Trump, in Wilmington, Delaware, Nov. 7, 2020. REUTERS/Jim Bourg

questions.title: Kamala Harris' historical victory
questions.description: "But while I may be the first woman in this office, I will not be the last. Because every little girl watching tonight sees that this is a country of possibilities and to the children of our country regardless of your gender..."  -- Kamala Harris
questions.resources:
Credit: PBS NewsHour Youtube
For an in-depth video on Kamala Harris' historic win, watch this PBS video: Vice President-elect Harris’ win brings many historic firsts https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/vice-president-elect-harris-win-brings-many-historic-firsts

questions.question: Do you think the U.S. will elect a woman president in your lifetime?

choices.answer: I hope so but am not sure we will

questions.title: Biden's first task: Handling COVID-19
questions.description: Biden said he would announce his COVID-19 task force on Monday which will have 12 health policy and technology experts. He said he will have a pandemic-testing board and a national supply chain commander as well as an effort to increase mask-wearing.

questions.question: Do you feel any more confident about COVID-19 now?

choices.answer: Yes, Biden will help the situation.
Maybe, I'll believe it when I see it.

questions.question: Which voter demographic had the biggest turnout for Biden?

questions.title: Black voter turnout
questions.description: Around 90% of Black voters voted for Joe Biden while President Trump got around 8% of Black turnout.

imageMetadata.altText: Black male voter Rob Baker wearing a T-shirt that says "Hope Dealer"
imageMetadata.resources: Joe Biden’s path to victory runs through battleground states like Wisconsin where Black voters in Milwaukee will play a pivotal role. But some, like Rob Baker, said they remained frustrated with Biden's record on law enforcement issues. Photo by Alex Wroblewski for the PBS Newshour

questions.resources: Joe Biden’s path to victory runs through battleground states like Wisconsin where Black voters in Milwaukee will play a pivotal role. But some, like Rob Baker, said they remained frustrated with Biden's record on law enforcement issues. Photo by Alex Wroblewski for the PBS Newshour

questions.question: Do you think voter-turnout will continue to be this strong?

choices.answer: Probably not, this election was very unique
